p: Limonene regarded as the second most commonly found terpene, also possesses antiplasmodial activity against . Limonene achieves its goal by targeting the intermediates of the active isoprenoid pathway of the parasite. Isoprenoid pathway plays a major role in parasite survival by mediating cell signaling, protein translation and several other biological processes (Jord√£o et al. 2011). Specifically, the isoprenic products that are inhibited from being synthesized are dolichol and ubiquinone (Goulart et al. 2004). The isoprenoid pathway of parasites is distinct from that found in mammals, which makes limonene a reliable constituent of antimalarial drug (Goulart et al. 2004). Thus, the host cell pathway will not be affected by the administration of the drug.
